As a newbie user/lurker myself I don't recall reading the FAQ, but
have made a note to look it up now...  

Perhaps a list member policy of responding to a "stupid" question
could be to simply provide a single response containing a URL pointer
back to the FAQ, and possibly to a bookmark within the FAQ that gets
them close.  There were 2-3 messages afew weeks back, "what is junit",
"please tell me how to use junit", etc and I recall at the time being
surprised at the energy from some of the responders that went into the
over the top responses when a single, simple "check the faq" or "go to
google" would have been sufficient.

As far as 2 lists go, a lot of the high level stuff goes over my head
right now, but as I'm going thru my steep learning curve I do have
moments where I grasp a new concept and then tie it back in to a post
that I've seen here on the list and have a lightbulb moment with
myself - "ahh, that's what that post was about".  So if 2 lists do end
up splitting out then I'd subscribe to both lists, the newbie to get
me up to speed, and the advanced list for an investment in my own
future learning.

My .02

Mike
